Posts.Content: debsta0229 wrote: Im confused and hope others can possibly lead me to a better understanding and ease stress in the confusion.  I was diagnosed lobular (estrogen positive) in 2/11.  My oncologist ordered  CA 27.29 tumor markers.  I later found he was ordering the CA 15-3 also but not every order.  He has now only ordered the CA 15-3.  My concern is due to the lobular metastasized should any other CA testing be completed to rule out any non estrogen positive findings?  I am sure many of you were the same as me by having annual pap smears and mammograms to be diagnosed that the breast cancer had metastasized.  After having double mastectomy and total hysterectomy now being treated for bone mets it is often a concern that there could possibly be something undetected.   Thanks for your help. Deb   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CA-27.29 and CA 15-3 debsta0229 teacher911

Posts.Content: May 10, 2013 01:52AM debsta0229 wrote: Good morning! Thanks for the replies.  I am new to this site so I wasnt sure if when you read my inquiry that my diagnosis information was indicated for those that were reading.  Stage 4 Lobular 2/11 with bone mets in hips, ribs, spine and pelvic. Currently on Femara & Faslodex.  My oncologist is aware of my feeling tired and  I was just seen by my family practice doctor on Tuesday of this week and let him know that I was extremely tired and of the kidney pain.  We have sorta figured out what that could be coming from now.  In 2012 I had 3 large kidney stones in the right kidney.  They lazer removed them but was not able to get all of the left over fragments in the top part of the kidney.  When I had the lower abdomen CT scan completed my doctor was able to see some small fragments in the kidney.  He feels with the dye/contrast and iron infusion could possibly cause the fragments to be on the move and pass.  I am taking pain meds and I do feel better now.  I am still tired but feeling better.   I think it was just the combo of treatments within a window of time.  I hope to be returning to work sometime next week.  That is really the hard part of this journey trying to live a somewhat normal life and fighting a disease at the same time.  Working 8 hours a day seems impossible some days.  Thanks again for your replies and have a great sunny day on your side of the street - Deb
Posts.Title: unsure what is causing the side effects debsta0229 LuAnnH

Posts.Content: debsta0229 wrote: Hi All Since April 25th I have had 2 iron infusions (within 2 weeks of each infusion), a CT scan with dye and contrast (of the lower abdomen) and 2 shots of Faslodex.  I have not felt well for weeks now.  I am exhausted and experience more emotional with anxiety.  I have been taking the Faslodex injections since 10/12 with a daily Femara since 3/11.  I usually have some side effects after the shots and infusions but I cant seem to regain my strength.  I sleep more and have to reserve my energy for things that I know I must do.  I have not been able to return to my job for over a week.  I have not been so fatigue and want to know what others think is going on.  Is it the iron infusions or a combo of all of them.  In addition to the fatigue I have been battling pain in my kidneys.  I am trying to relax and get as much rest as I possibly can.  Any suggestions or personal comments to help me understand what exactly is going on. Thanks Deb Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: unsure what is causing the side effects debsta0229 LuAnnH
